content:
In a fantasy Dungeons and Dragons world inspired by Warhammer 40k, the party could find themselves caught up in a complex and dangerous story that involves the refraction of souls in the Warp, the moral ambiguity of the various factions in the world, the legend of the "Deep That Dreams" located at the center of a group of spiraling islands known as "The Thousand Eyes," an ancient crashed spaceship, the fear of chaotic infection, the fear of a necromantic plague, and mysterious entities known as the Depthar.

The story could begin when the party is hired by a wealthy merchant or noble who seeks to acquire a rare and valuable artifact known as the Refractor of Souls, which is said to have the power to refract the souls of the living into the Warp. The merchant believes that the artifact is located on one of the spiraling islands known as "The Thousand Eyes," and he offers the party a handsome reward for retrieving it.

As the party sets out on their mission, they soon discover that they are not the only ones seeking the artifact. They encounter a variety of factions, including chaos cultists, powerful psykers, and rival merchants, who are all vying for control of the artifact. These factions offer the party tempting deals and try to coerce them into joining their cause, making it difficult for the party to determine who to trust.

As the party delves deeper into the mystery of the artifact, they discover that it is located on an ancient crashed spaceship at the center of the Thousand Eyes. They also learn that the artifact is protected by a powerful psychic entity known as the Deep That Dreams, which is said to sleep at the heart of the ship.
